required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nasopharyngeal Airway Facilitate Transnasal Humidified Rapid Insufflation Ventilatory Exchange
clinical_study.official_title: Nasopharyngeal Airway Facilitate Transnasal Humidified Rapid Insufflation Ventilatory Exchange

brief_summary.textblock: For performing transnasal humidified rapid insufflation ventilatory exchange (THRIVE), jaw-thrust maneuver have to maintain to make sure the airway open and the CO2 clearance during apnoea. The objective of present study is to prove that nasopharyngeal airway facilitate THRIVE and no need jaw-thrust maneuver and maintain the similar PO2 and PCO2 during apnoea.

primary_outcome.measure: The partial pressure of carbon dioxide (pCO2)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start to end of THRIVE(20 minutes)
From start to end of THRIVE(20 minutes)

arm_group.description: Transnasal humidified rapid-insufflation ventilatory exchange (THRIVE) during induction using jaw-thrust maneuver.
Transnasal humidified rapid-insufflation ventilatory exchange (THRIVE) during induction with nasopharyngeal airway.

intervention.description: THRIVE with a regular nasopharyngeal airway.

overall_official.affiliation: Renji Hospital, School of Medicine, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China
